Finding A: Examples of ASD candidate genes identified by small de novo CNVs include SETD5, DTNA (MIM 6012), and LSAMP (MIM 6032) (Supplemental Data section \'\'Highlighted Genes,\'\' Figures S9, S10, and S14).
Finding B: Point mutations of the KL gene in humans are associated with hypertension and kidney disease, which suggests that a-Klotho may be essential to the maintenance of normal renal function.
Finding C: We conclude that continuous, year-round virus perpetuation (and perhaps heterogeneity in modes of transmission and infectious doses during and after epidemics) acts to reduce the efficiency of RHDV and MYXV as biocontrol agents of rabbits
Finding D: Increases in infectiousness as the fungus grows on hibernating bats may drive winter transmission, with loads increasing throughout the winter.

Biology_466_r$Biology_tweet_21_p$Biology.text:
Finding A: Wallace and colleagues showed that in the mice, relatively mild mutations in mitochondrial genes, located in either mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) or nuclear DNA, produced unique whole-body stress-response signatures, indicated by physiological and gene expression patterns.
Finding B: Consequently, the noiseinduced simplification of dolphin whistles may reduce the information content in these acoustic signals and decrease effective communication, parent -offspring proximity or group cohesion.
Finding C: Coral colonies, inhabiting the same reef and apparently exposed to identical conditions, will bleach and die at different rates Obura, 2001; .
Finding D: This study demonstrated that a viable stem cell population can be isolated and expanded from equine cadaver ligaments up to 72 hours post-mortem.

Biology_116_r$Biology_107_p$Biology_158_.text:
Finding A: The researchers found that study plots with lianas accumulated 76 percent less biomass over the experimental period due to reduced tree growth and increased tree death.
Finding B: If a vessel is located in a different direction from conspecifics, there may be a decrease in masking (spatial release from masking) , but the observed changes in the whistle signals indicate that the dolphins simplified their calls to counter the masking effects of vessel noise.
Finding C: The differences between male and female iPS cells are most pronounced for one of the key processes in the field of epigenetics: DNA methylation, a modification that changes the activity of a DNA segment without changing its sequence.
Finding D: BAP1 mutations are seen in #leukemia, #mesothelioma, #cholangiocarcinoma, uveal #melanoma & renal cancer. Boyi Gan from @username has shown how BAP1 suppresses tumor formation through inhibition of SLC7A11 transporter & elevated ferroptosis.
